summary: This is an email exchange between an FBI agent and a U.S. Attorney's Office staff member (USAFLS) discussing logistical issues related to sending letters, possibly for legal or investigative purposes. The FBI agent mentions locating an address in Carrollton, Virginia, and references stress related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Tein
persons.context: Referenced as the author of a letter that the FBI agent had not yet read, indicating Tein is involved in the correspondence chain related to the case.

events.title: Email exchange regarding case logistics
events.description: An FBI agent and a U.S. Attorney's Office staff member discuss sending letters, including one from Tein, and locating an address in Carrollton, Virginia for inclusion with a lead to Bogota.

keyFacts: The document is an email from July 22, 2008, showing communication between law enforcement officials about the Epstein case.
The FBI agent expresses significant stress, mentioning 'pain in my gut' and wondering if it's 'an ulcer from Epstein'.
An address in Carrollton, Virginia (23314) was located and needed to be included with a lead to Bogota.
The email references a letter from someone named Tein that the FBI agent had not yet read.
